question: 大輔
sourceMnemonic:
Who's a <kanji>big</kanji> <kanji>help</kanji>? That'll be <vocabulary>Daisuke</vocabulary>!

Famous Daisukes include film director and screenwriter Itō Daisuke (<ja>伊藤 大輔</ja>), figure skater Takahashi Daisuke (<ja>髙橋 大輔</ja>), and actor and singer Namikawa Daisuke (<ja>浪川 大輔</ja>).
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This name uses the on'yomi for <ja>大</ja> and the nanori for <ja>輔</ja>. You learned both of these with the kanji, so that should be a big help.

Note: Historically, this name can be read <ja>たいふ</ja> or <ja>おおすけ</ja>, as is the case for Heian period poet <ja>伊勢大輔</ja>, whose name can be read either <ja>いせのたいふ</ja> or <ja>いせのおおすけ</ja>. In modern contexts, you'll only need to know <ja>だいすけ</ja> though, not to worry!
